results.title: Admission impossible
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Chris Oliver and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The very first Act passed by Australia’s first parliament was a law to exclude non-white races from Australia. “Admission impossible” is the true story of the behind-the-scenes political forces and propaganda that created the infamous White Australia Policy which was enforced until 1972. Eyewitness accounts and recently discovered confidential documents reveal how immigration officers carried out racial selectivity to discriminate against Asians, Jews and non-European applicants. The last part of the program discusses the impact the Vietnam War had on the reversal of this policy.

results.title: La Stupenda: a portrait of Dame Joan Sutherland
results.creator_credit: Derek Bailey, Brian Adams and Landseer Film and Television Productions
results.brief_description: A celebration of the life and career of Australia’s most famous opera star, Dame Joan Sutherland, culminating in her farewell performances in Sydney and London in 1990. Sutherland’s career spanned more than forty years. “La Stupenda” provides an overview of the highlights of her career.

results.title: Women in the surf (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The first non-fiction feature about Australia’s women of the surf tells the history of women’s surfing in Australia from 1915. It moves through the big board era to the present day, with women coming into a surfing entity in their own right. The video shows the women surf riders surfing their own calendar and tells of their hopes, fears and pleasures as they ride the waves.

results.title: Women 88
results.brief_description: Women ‘88 is a series of seven five minute films. The series was produced for the Women’s Program Bicentennial Authority and celebrates and promotes the past and present quality of Australian Women’s achievement, so as to inspire pride in, and respect for, their diverse contributions to the evolution of Australian society.

results.title: A Song of air
results.brief_description: An autobiographical account of a daughter’s relationship with her father from the interior of a “typical” Australian family of the 1950’s. Using original 16mm home movie footage filmed by her father, she speaks by means of voice-over of his severe religious and patriarchal oppression, and her resistance to his values and expectations.

results.title: All that glitters
results.brief_description: In September 1982, forty-five nations of the Commonwealth sent 1,500 athletes to Brisbane for the Twelfth Commonwealth Games. This program focuses on athletes and coaches, highlighting their relationships, lifestyles and training and their individual struggles. This film is the official film of the 12th Commonwealth Games, held in Brisbane, and is a combination of the films featured in the “Striving ” series.

results.title: Having a go: a look at small business in Australia
results.creator_credit: Richard Cassidy, Tony Coyte, Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Presents interviews with entrepreneurs from five successful small Australian businesses. Each provides advice on how to succeed while stressing the need to be fully informed and equipped with proper business skills. Highlights the importance of government sponsored small business agencies for providing information and training.

results.title: The Teacher and the Computer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
Teacher, Anne McDougall, talks about the introduction of computers into education and the relationship of the teacher and the computer, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18, 1980.
